column1: We offer a broad range of services for children as young as five and throughout adulthood. We understand that people with special needs are people first and that their individual challenges are just part of what makes them special.

We have determined that our servers are outdated and are considering migrating to the Cloud. Before we can make the decision we need someone to assist us with considering the benefits and drawbacks of having our information in the Cloud. We are specifically interested in learning what data could be moved to the cloud
column2: would we retain ownership of our data and what are the security concerns of the Cloud? Having information easily shared and accessible will allow us to be more effective and serve more special needs children and their families."

column1: CTQVR|"We exist to help communities solve the most complex problems affecting their most vulnerable
column2: hardest hit neighbors."|"New York-NY"|"USA"|"x"||"The Brownsville Partnership seeks assistance in developing a database to support our effort to place 5
column3: 000 Brownsville residents into jobs. Brownsville Brooklyn faces many challenges
column4: chief among them is the communities lack of employment. For example
column5: we are in the beginning of the campaigns prototype stage where we are working with three public housing buildings.  70% of working age residents in these buildings are unemployed
column6: which is only slightly above the average unemployment rate for public housing residents which constitutes over 30% of housing in Brownsville.

column1: This database will be the foundation for 1. tracking the path of a Brownsville resident from assessment to placement and 2. tracking improvements in the efficiency of the system we develop to place residents into jobs.
The data about employability of residents and the barriers in making them employable should be stored in a enterprise  database
column2: so its easier to analyze the data and generate intelligent reports(suggested database to start with: MySQL).

column1: For punching in the data (from a questionnaire on employability for Brownsville residents)
column2: a lightweight web application should be developed
column3: that would allow for easier input and provide access for multiple users to simultaneously record/update the details(suggested technologies for creating the webapp: Open source Apache Tomcat web server and Spring Framework).

column1: Once the application development is complete and its deemed fit for production use
column2: the application can be deployed on a Cloud based PaaS solution like Red Hat OpenShift or Google App Engine.

column1: We are very grateful for the opportunity to post this project and look forward to collaborating on the project in the future."

column1: YALXP|||||"x"|"YALXPis a fully tested Laravel inventory solution. column2: stocks and inventory items are automatically given the current logged in user's ID. All inventory actions such as puts/removes/creations are covered by Laravel's built in database transactions. If any exception occurs during an inventory change

column5: or you can simply use the built in models.Requirements • Laravel 4.* | 5.* • Laravel's Auth

column1: YCLOL|||||"x"|"An interface where administrator can manage products easily on one page and quickly perform the common products actions. From the left there is a tree of taxonomies
column2: where admin can manage nodes just like he does it in /admin/taxonomies now (create
column3: move
column4: rename etc.). After each taxon there is a number of products
column5: having this taxon. By clicking on a taxon or taxonomy admin can see products having taxons in a selected node. Products are shown in Products list. Products list contains the following columns: • Selecting checkbox (helps to select a set of products for group processing). • SKU • Product name (also a link to edit product) • Main price • Indicator if a product has image • Quick actions Products list have pagination and ""products per page"" selector (10/50/100/All).Each product has the following quick actions (from left to right): •Indicator if the product is shown in a shop. If an indicator is dark
column6: the product is hidden. By clicking on a dark indicator product becomes available from now. Light indicator tells that the product is active; admin can hide the product from now by clicking it. • Preview the product on site (opens in a new tab). • Edit product. • Clone product. • Delete product.Above the Products list there a button ""New product in this category"". This button opens ""new product"" dialog with pre-defined taxon (current selected taxon).Quick group products processing controls from the right perform just the most common actions with selected products: • Publish from (select date). • Quick hide from now. • Add a taxon to selected products (select taxon from combo-box). • Delete selected products."

It has been supercededd by Adrien Thebo's module which can be found here: http://forge.puppetlabs.com/adrien/network Overview This module provides types for network management : • Device configuration files using the network_config type • Live network management using the network_interface type Note: network_interface and network_config types are not dependant on each other in any way. network_interface is experimental. The 'network_config' type The network_config type is used to maintain persistent network configuration. Only redhat-derivatives (RHEL
column2: Fedora
column3: CentOS) are currently supported."

column1: YUFWI|||||"x"|"A discovery service and client for finding and configuring razberi devices over the network. Also provides a central server for collecting status information from razberis on the network. The central server can be configured in a variety of ways: • A standalone server that runs on a single unit (good for when the deployment only has a single razberi) • A server located on the LAN that all units on the network can reach (good for when all sites are connected via a VPN or are located on the same subnet as the management server) • A server located in the cloud
column2: hosted by Razberi (good for when sites are independently setup and all have a route to the internet
column3: also reduces burden of hosting a management server)The razberi devices are configured to push relevant information about itself to the central server on a periodic basis."

column1: YYKNF|||||"x"|"The goal of this project is to have a unified way of programming your large-scale dynamic networks. Think of it as a blend between puppet
column2: nagios
column3: collectd
column4: graphite
column5: shipyard
column6: security groups
column7: cloudformation. How does it work? YYKNF allows you to define your network as a set of resources in a .yml file. Example resource types: • Nodes • NetworkInterfaces • Classes • IpRuleSets •...etc Each 'Resource' has a unique id and can have zero or more classes. The id and class structure allows you to target your resources in comparable way to CSS selectors. Once you have defined your network (resources) in a .yml file
column8: you can load the topology into memory. The loaded structure can now be used to develop various network-based configuration management tools. Example tools:• Distributed iptable rules generator: Define rules by referencing other nodes by id or classname (dynamic configuration) • Configuration management: define installed packages
column9: and generate config files per host • Monitorring: define monitorring rules by classnames per host Please refer to the example/ directory for example network configurations. This project is in early-stage development Installation This project uses composer to manage it's dependencies. Simply run composer install to install all dependencies in the vendor/ directory."
